2019-04-28T14:01:38Z: That's all from Autosport Live's coverage of the Azerbaijan Grand Prix won by Valtteri Bottas. Join us again in two weeks time for the Spanish Grand Prix, but stick with Autosport in the coming days for news and analysis, videos and podcasts following the race in Baku.Baku Formula 1 race report: Bottas fends off Hamilton in AzerbaijanValtteri Bottas withstood a late charge from Lewis Hamilton to win Formula 1's Azerbaijan Grand Prix and atone for his heartbreak at the end of last year's race in Baku
2019-04-28T13:58:01Z: It's a silent 'green room' as the drivers await the podium.
2019-04-28T13:54:45Z: Hamilton looks to be forcing positivity after finishing second, but follows Bottas's lead in crediting the Mercedes team for its work.
2019-04-28T13:52:25Z: Vettel congratulates Bottas and Hamilton at the scales. Ferrari had no answer in the end for Mercedes.
2019-04-28T13:47:29Z: Out of the points: 11 Albon; 12 Giovinazzi; 13 Magnussen; 14 Hulkenberg; 15 Russell; 16 Kubica
2019-04-28T13:47:25Z: Result: 1 Bottas; 2 Hamilton; 3 Vettel; 4 Verstappen; 5 Leclerc; 6 Perez; 7 Sainz; 8 Norris; 9 Stroll; 10 Raikkonen
2019-04-28T13:46:30Z: Leclerc's time was a scintillating 1m43.009s. Phwoar.
2019-04-28T13:45:47Z: After heartbreak last year, VALTTERI BOTTAS WINS THE AZERBAIJAN GRAND PRIX!
2019-04-28T13:45:13Z: Leclerc is flying on his new softs, and takes the fastest lap on the penultimate tour.
2019-04-28T13:43:51Z: A race-best middle sector from Bottas.
2019-04-28T13:43:27Z: No DRS for Hamilton last time around. He'll need that next time.
2019-04-28T13:42:30Z: Hamilton pulls back three tenths in the last stint. This is epic.
2019-04-28T13:42:08Z: HAMILTON LOSES TWO TENTHS IN SECTOR TWO! That's a net three tenths lost in the first two sectors. Bottas is replying in kind.
2019-04-28T13:41:22Z: Bottas is a tenth quicker in sector one next time around.
2019-04-28T13:40:38Z: FASTEST LAP FROM HAMILTON! He's with Bottas now...
2019-04-28T13:40:13Z: Personal best and race best sectors from Hamilton on this lap so far...
2019-04-28T13:39:43Z: Leclerc pits to have a go at taking fastest lap.
2019-04-28T13:39:30Z: Stroll and Raikkonen are secure in ninth and 10th after strong races - particularly by pitlane starter Raikkonen.
2019-04-28T13:39:10Z: Bottas was faster than Hamilton last time around and looks to have the pace to manage this. Not long to go!
2019-04-28T13:39:00Z: Mad events aside, it's hard to see much changing in the final laps even in the midfield. Perez is now 4s clear of Sainz in the fight for sixth and Norris is falling away from them rather than catching.
2019-04-28T13:37:09Z: Vettel, Verstappen and Leclerc look set to finish in that order as it stands.
2019-04-28T13:36:47Z: Hamilton has closed to within one and a half seconds of Bottas.
2019-04-28T13:36:28Z: Five laps to go next time around.
2019-04-28T13:35:26Z: Kubica has made a second pitstop to take softs at last. He's 16th (and last) and 46s behind team-mate Russell now, some of that due to his penalty.
2019-04-28T13:34:52Z: Chucking on new softs during the VSC isn't paying off for anyone so far - Norris is only inching back towards Perez and Sainz rather than charging, and Magnussen and Hulkenberg look unlikely to get anywhere from 13th and 14th.
2019-04-28T13:34:24Z: Since the VSC, Verstappen is struggling to match his earlier pace as Vettel is leading the battle for the podium now.
2019-04-28T13:33:49Z: Bottas sets the fastest lap of the race to hold Hamilton two seconds at bay.
2019-04-28T13:32:55Z: Verstappen is told to stay off the exit kerb at Turn 16. It could relate to the issue Gasly had with his car there.
2019-04-28T13:32:21Z: Hamilton reported he'd lost two seconds on the VSC delta, and looks to be trying to make up for it now.
2019-04-28T13:31:19Z: Hamilton responds to Vettel's pace, going fastest of anyone last time around.
2019-04-28T13:30:37Z: Outside the points: 11 Albon; 12 Giovinazzi; 13 Magnussen; 14 Hulkenberg; 15 Russell; 16 Kubica
2019-04-28T13:30:20Z: Vettel is rapid after that VSC, almost within two seconds of Hamilton now.
2019-04-28T13:30:16Z: Race order: 1 Bottas; 2 Hamilton; 3 Vettel; 4 Verstappen; 5 Leclerc; 6 Perez; 7 Sainz; 8 Norris; 9 Stroll; 10 Raikkonen
2019-04-28T13:29:48Z: Leclerc was the big loser in the VSC, now 28s behind Verstappen.
2019-04-28T13:29:47Z: Norris's pitstop only cost him one place, to team-mate Sainz. He's got fresh soft tyres now and nine laps to close the 11s gap to the other McLaren, then see if he can pass it and sixth placed Perez.
2019-04-28T13:29:20Z: Verstappen got a bit out of shape near the castle on the restart but won't lose much time.
2019-04-28T13:28:56Z: Bottas definitely did best out of that restart, his gap to Hamilton over three seconds now.
2019-04-28T13:27:21Z: The VSC always mixes things up and can be advantageous and disadvantageous for drivers depending on where it ends. This restart could be crucial to deciding the race.
2019-04-28T13:26:57Z: Magnussen takes advantage of this VSC to pit and go back to softs as well.
2019-04-28T13:26:34Z: Norris makes a surprise pitstop and swaps back to softs. That takes him off Perez's tail but he rejoins in eighth ahead of Stroll still.
2019-04-28T13:26:07Z: Russell makes a second pitstop and this time takes softs after running two sets of mediums so far. He rejoins still ahead of team-mate Kubica.
2019-04-28T13:25:36Z: Grosjean comes into the pits and retires his Haas.
2019-04-28T13:25:16Z: Smoke pours from Gasly's Red Bull and he's lost power. He's made it into a run-off area.
2019-04-28T13:24:47Z: Verstappen had just set the fastest lap of the race.
2019-04-28T13:23:45Z: Verstappen is coming. He's just two seconds behind Vettel now.
2019-04-28T13:23:20Z: After Hamilton had just taken three tenths out of Bottas, the latter follows with a race best first sector.
2019-04-28T13:22:20Z: Verstappen has worked hard today, and his gap to Vettel is down to 3.3s now. He's not out of the fight for the podium.
2019-04-28T13:21:37Z: Norris is now having a proper go at passing Perez for seventh place.
2019-04-28T13:21:35Z: Leclerc has set a personal best last time around, but he's still slower than Verstappen ahead.
2019-04-28T13:20:24Z: Perhaps crucially, Hamilton was the last to stop of the top three, so he has one less lap on his mediums.
2019-04-28T13:19:16Z: The top three are closing up. Hamilton is 1.6s behind Bottas, but Vettel is just over two seconds behind Hamilton too.
2019-04-28T13:18:28Z: That was a nice move from Leclerc, into the less popular Turn 3 rather than Turn 1.
2019-04-28T13:17:50Z: Leclerc has passed Gasly quickly, which could be key to any charge towards the podium.
2019-04-28T13:17:48Z: Hulkenberg makes a second pitstop and returns to softs, while Grosjean has finally pitted for the first time and taken softs too. They rejoin 15th and 16th, 25s behind the back of the main midfield pack and well clear of the Williams.
2019-04-28T13:17:07Z: Hamilton took half a second out of Bottas last time around meaning the gap is back under two seconds.
2019-04-28T13:17:01Z: Kvyat's car is being retired due to damage from that Ricciardo clash - which was basically like a parking dispute - as well.
2019-04-28T13:16:38Z: Leclerc emerges behind Gasly, which could be costly for Leclerc.
2019-04-28T13:16:13Z: The gaps from first to second and second to third are stabilised around 2.2s at the moment. There's plenty still to happen in this race.
2019-04-28T13:15:12Z: Verstappen is flying and is the next in line to catch Leclerc.
2019-04-28T13:14:04Z: Vettel has passed Leclerc for third at Turn 1.
2019-04-28T13:14:01Z: Norris has got a lot closer to Perez for seventh in the last few laps.
2019-04-28T13:13:37Z: Kvyat is back up and running in 17th, a lap down now, but Ricciardo is in the Renault pit and looks like his race is over.
2019-04-28T13:13:24Z: Being caught behind Vettel for another lap cost Hamilton who has dropped to two seconds behind his team-mate.
2019-04-28T13:12:23Z: The move came at Turn 1 with DRS.
2019-04-28T13:12:11Z: Hamilton has also jumped past Leclerc, the Mercedes top two is reformed.
2019-04-28T13:12:06Z: Kvyat and Ricciardo didn't make any contact in the initial incident - Kvyat simply couldn't turn with the Renault sliding off on his inside. But Ricciardo then reversed into Kvyat quite heavily as both tried to turn in the escape road.
2019-04-28T13:10:47Z: The Ricciardo/Kvyat incident has moved Stroll back into the points in 10th.
2019-04-28T13:10:28Z: Bottas takes the lead from Leclerc at Turn 1!
2019-04-28T13:10:21Z: Ricciardo had been all over the back of Kvyat for several laps but was being fended off. The Renault took a lunge into Turn 3 and both went down the escape road.
2019-04-28T13:10:06Z: Scratch that, Verstappen sets the fastest lap of the race and the gap is under seven seconds now.
2019-04-28T13:09:33Z: Verstappen has taken around two seconds out of Vettel in this stint, but is still over seven seconds behind.
2019-04-28T13:08:58Z: Ricciardo is now working hard on Kvyat for 10th but has yet to manage a move.
2019-04-28T13:08:49Z: Hamilton is in DRS range of Bottas but not close enough to make a move just yet.
2019-04-28T13:08:15Z: Mercedes is filling in Bottas on the gaps ahead and behind. Silence is the only reply.
2019-04-28T13:07:16Z: Hamilton may catch Bottas before the latter catches Leclerc here.
2019-04-28T13:05:54Z: Hamilton has been quietly chipping away at Bottas, too, with 1.3s now between the two. The top five is closing up.
2019-04-28T13:05:13Z: The gap between Bottas and Leclerc is down under two seconds now. Surely Leclerc is about to pit.
2019-04-28T13:05:04Z: Tenth-placed Kvyat is being caught by Ricciardo at quite a rate now.
2019-04-28T13:04:47Z: Perez is still controlling the best of the rest contest in seventh, sitting a second and a half ahead of Norris, who has a solid 2.6s gap to team-mate Sainz in ninth.
2019-04-28T13:04:36Z: Vettel has set a fastest first sector, but can't match that through the rest of the lap.
2019-04-28T13:04:19Z: Albon overtakes Hulkenberg for 16th, not long after banging the Turn 1 wall for the second time in this race.
2019-04-28T13:03:34Z: The track temperature has decreased by around six degrees centigrade from the start of the race.
2019-04-28T13:02:50Z: Leclerc and Gasly pumping in fastest sectors means they could be approaching their pitstops in the next few laps.
2019-04-28T13:02:00Z: Leclerc has picked his pace up again, matching Bottas last time around. The gap is stagnant at three seconds.
2019-04-28T13:01:10Z: Albon overtakes Grosjean too, so he's down to 18th ahead of just the two Williams, which have now made their pitstops.
2019-04-28T13:00:53Z: Hamilton has picked up his pace and Vettel has backed off or lost some of his. So the gap between the two is 3.3s now.
2019-04-28T12:59:40Z: Leclerc sets a personal best, but it's still 0.6s slower than Bottas and that means the Finn is just three seconds behind now.
2019-04-28T12:59:34Z: Grosjean is now back to 17th, having rejoined from the escape road just in front of Hulkenberg and Giovinazzi then been quickly overtaken by both.
2019-04-28T12:58:32Z: Hamilton's sudden loss of pace could be explained by assuming he is looking after his tyres. The next few laps could be key in this race as Vettel closes in.
2019-04-28T12:57:57Z: Grosjean goes down the Turn 15 escape road while trying to fend off Ricciardo. He falls to 15th place.
2019-04-28T12:56:30Z: On lap 24, Bottas is well within five seconds of catching Leclerc now. Hamilton's pace has dropped off and just at the right time, Vettel is flying. Vettel is 2.2s behind Hamilton now.
2019-04-28T12:55:23Z: Ricciardo's pace at this point is excellent - he's passed Magnussen and is up to 12th. The still-to-stop Grosjean is his next target and catching him won't take long at this rate.
2019-04-28T12:54:08Z: A poor lap from Hamilton has given Bottas a boost with the gap up to three seconds between them.
2019-04-28T12:53:32Z: Mercedes are still regularly in the 1m45s. The big question now is, when Vettel takes the soft tyres late on, will they actually be quicker than the medium? All of the frontrunners are quicker on the medium than they were on the soft. Of course, when Leclerc gets the softs, he'll have less fuel, and those around him will have worn mediums. It's a fascinating battle for the top three today.
2019-04-28T12:52:28Z: Raikkonen has been overtaken by both Ricciardo and Stroll and is down to 15th.
2019-04-28T12:51:46Z: Class B order on lap 22: 7 Perez; 8 Norris; 9 Sainz; 10 Kvyat; 11 Grosjean; 12 Magnussen; 13 Ricciardo; 14 Stroll; 15 Raikkonen; 16 Hulkenberg; 17 Giovinazzi; 18 Albon; 19 Russell; 20 Kubica
2019-04-28T12:51:41Z: Verstappen takes the fastest lap now, clearly not content with yielding to Leclerc and Vettel in the fight for the podium. The Dutchman is 9.4s behind Vettel as it stands.
2019-04-28T12:50:53Z: Bottas bounces back from a poor lap with a personal best to bring the gap to Leclerc under nine seconds. Leclerc started on the medium tyre, an alternate strategy to the other leaders, and will get the faster, softer tyre late in the race.
2019-04-28T12:49:52Z: Bottas is told to keep reeling in Leclerc by Mercedes. Meanwhile Hamilton sets another fastest lap, and is almost within two seconds of Bottas. That gap was four seconds at the start of the stint.
2019-04-28T12:48:37Z: Replays show Verstappen kicking up dust on the tricky Turn 16 kerb. On the next tour he sets a race-best middle sector.
2019-04-28T12:47:39Z: Despite him having to wave Verstappen by - and despite the hat-trick of pitlane start penalties in the lead-up - this has easily looked like Pierre Gasly's most assured race as a Red Bull driver yet.He's made easy work of the midfield pack on fresh mediums, and should be on course for a comfortable sixth-place finish - and that's assuming no chaos up ahead.
2019-04-28T12:47:33Z: Hamilton is flying, the first man into the 1m45s so far as the gap to Bottas falls to under three seconds now.
2019-04-28T12:46:47Z: Giovinazzi is past Russell and into 17th.
2019-04-28T12:46:41Z: Leclerc is trying to respond, setting a personal best on lap 18.
2019-04-28T12:46:37Z: Raikkonen was another driver to pit extremely early to switch from softs to mediums. His pace isn't great now and he's 13th with Ricciardo right on the back of him and both Stroll and Hulkenberg catching them.
2019-04-28T12:46:10Z: Bottas takes control with the fastest lap, more importantly erasing some of that crucial advantage that current leader Leclerc holds. The gap is down to just over 10 seconds.
2019-04-28T12:45:58Z: Kvyat is past the yet-to-stop Grosjean too and back into the points.
2019-04-28T12:45:33Z: Russell's Williams has fallen back to 17th and has Giovinazzi on its tail with Albon not far behind. Kubica is 14s off the back of the field after his penalty and has still got to take his first stop.
2019-04-28T12:44:57Z: The midfield cars that are on the 'Leclerc strategy' are going backwards at the moment - Grosjean has just lost ninth to Sainz and is now under pressure from Kvyat.
2019-04-28T12:44:32Z: Another fastest lap from Hamilton on lap 16. Bottas is in the same ballpark so Hamilton isn't scything into the deficit against his team-mate.
2019-04-28T12:42:57Z: Where did that come from? Hamilton sets a 1m46.588s to go fastest of anyone so far. That's pushed Vettel over two seconds behind him.
2019-04-28T12:42:08Z: Norris is now past the yet-to-pit Grosjean into eighth, and Sainz looks like he'll be copying his team-mate very soon.
2019-04-28T12:41:25Z: Bottas has eked his gap to Hamilton to on or just over four seconds, while the margin between Hamilton and Vettel seems to have stabilised at around 1.5s. It's finely poised.
2019-04-28T12:41:20Z: Having pitted very early after running into swift soft tyre trouble, Kvyat is now back up to 11th behind the two McLarens.
2019-04-28T12:40:43Z: Kubica takes his penalty and rejoins 20th, 5s behind Albon ahead.
2019-04-28T12:40:33Z: Leclerc leads by 13.601s now, but is yet to stop. When he pits much later in the race for the softs on the alternate strategy, he should be rapid and a threat for the podium.
2019-04-28T12:40:10Z: And Perez very swiftly passes Grosjean, who'll soon be caught by the two McLarens.
2019-04-28T12:39:52Z: Perez has rapidly caught the yet-to-pit Grosjean for seventh.
2019-04-28T12:39:47Z: Verstappen finally pits his Red Bull. No doubt they were covering off a safety car there.
2019-04-28T12:39:34Z: Kubica is now 15th having just been passed by Raikkonen, and will drop to last with that penalty.
2019-04-28T12:39:16Z: Kubica gets a drivethrough penalty for going to the pitlane exit too early ahead of the race.
2019-04-28T12:39:14Z: Vettel is within two seconds of Hamilton, so the undercut looks like it hasn't quite worked. Depending on how long it takes Hamilton to heat the tyres.
2019-04-28T12:38:18Z: Vettel has done all he can by setting the fastest lap of the race at his first attempt proper on the mediums.
2019-04-28T12:37:52Z: Grosjean is now up to seventh place, running the mediums on which he started. The Williams are on the same strategy and are 12th and 14th with Russell and Kubica, split by Magnussen.
2019-04-28T12:37:45Z: Hamilton pits for mediums. Will Vettel jump him?
2019-04-28T12:36:40Z: Hamilton into the 1m50s now while Leclerc on the mediums is still in the 1m47s. Great stop for Bottas.
2019-04-28T12:36:18Z: Sainz pits, which elevates Gasly to sixth from his pitlane start after just 13 laps.
2019-04-28T12:36:05Z: Fastest lap for Leclerc and Bottas pits.
2019-04-28T12:35:47Z: Leclerc sets a personal best to continue a strong lap. He's 5.4s behind Hamilton but at this rate that will only last a couple of laps.
2019-04-28T12:34:56Z: Vettel will get an undercut on the Mercedes drivers now.
2019-04-28T12:34:45Z: Clear of Vettel, Leclerc sets a fastest first sector of the race.
2019-04-28T12:34:21Z: A really poor lap from Hamilton, a 1m49.820s.Vettel pits for mediums.
2019-04-28T12:34:20Z: Now up to seventh, Gasly is rapidly catching Sainz's McLaren ahead but has a 7s gap to close there.
2019-04-28T12:33:36Z: Ricciardo jumps Stroll in the pits and they rejoin 17th and 18th - just ahead of Hulkenberg and Giovinazzi.
2019-04-28T12:33:35Z: Bottas has dropped time to Hamilton with the gap now below three seconds. They have a tough decision to make on when to pit here, as they are struggling on the softs but Leclerc will be likely be fast late in the race on those tyres.
2019-04-28T12:33:15Z: Perez's stop successfully covers off Norris - he rejoins 10th ahead of the McLaren still.
2019-04-28T12:32:36Z: Perez pits, and team-mate Stroll does too. Ricciardo is also in.
2019-04-28T12:32:20Z: Great move from Gasly to take eighth from Stroll at one of the fast corners at the back of the circuit. Though Stroll looks like he might've just fallen off the pace.
2019-04-28T12:32:17Z: Leclerc is in the high 1m47s on his mediums, while Vettel is in the 1m49s. The three-second gap between the two will be dust in no time.
2019-04-28T12:31:48Z: Norris comes out on mediums after his pitstop, between the two Williams in 14th.
2019-04-28T12:31:34Z: Leclerc makes the move on Verstappen at Turn 1. He takes fourth behind team-mate Vettel.
2019-04-28T12:31:29Z: Gasly passes Albon and Ricciardo in quick succession, and then gains another place as Norris pits. The second Red Bull is ninth now.
2019-04-28T12:31:15Z: Verstappen reports a lack of engine braking in his Red Bull.
2019-04-28T12:31:03Z: The lead gap is stuck just over three seconds at the moment. Both Mercedes are struggling on the soft tyres.
2019-04-28T12:30:34Z: Kvyat is the best of the cars that made a very early stop to shed softs and take mediums. He's 16th, 4s clear of Magnussen, with Raikkonen, Hulkenberg and Giovinazzi completing the field.
2019-04-28T12:30:06Z: Grosjean, Russell and Kubica are running spaced out in 13th, 14th and 15th, the last of the cars that have not pitted already.
2019-04-28T12:29:59Z: Leclerc's pace on the mediums is brilliant, fastest man on track at the moment. Once he's clear of Verstappen he'll be within five seconds of Vettel on this alternate strategy.
2019-04-28T12:29:33Z: In ninth place, Stroll has fallen 6s away from the McLarens ahead and has Ricciardo, Albon and Gasly close behind him.
2019-04-28T12:29:08Z: Hulkenberg comes in, swapping softs for mediums too.
2019-04-28T12:29:01Z: Leclerc does a fastest first sector on lap nine, looking to real in Verstappen. There's just over a second between them but that could disappear by the end of the lap.
2019-04-28T12:28:56Z: Sainz passes McLaren team-mate Norris to take seventh. They're close behind Perez's Racing Point still.
2019-04-28T12:27:46Z: Giovinazzi pits too, another driver getting rid of softs very early and taking mediums.
2019-04-28T12:27:33Z: This is strong work from Leclerc, who is already back in the top five after just six laps and is outpacing his team-mate Vettel, despite being on slower tyres. Right now, Leclerc is in podium contention. But if he wants to win, he probably needs to hope the race remains without a safety car for a little while longer. There's also a very narrow window later in the race where a safety car could emerge just as Leclerc's ready to switch to soft tyres. Then he could pit, change to quicker rubber, and rejoin right with rivals on harder, slower tyres. A victory would be on the cards then. It's not as unlikely in Baku as it would be somewhere else...
2019-04-28T12:27:20Z: Magnussen is next to make an early pitstop, which elevates Gasly to 12th.
2019-04-28T12:27:04Z: Bottas is in the high 1m47s. Hamilton in the 48s and the Ferraris in the 49s. There's a huge pace differential so far between Mercedes and Ferrari.
2019-04-28T12:27:00Z: The two Williams are keeping up with Giovinazzi's Alfa in a battle for 16th at the moment.
2019-04-28T12:25:57Z: Raikkonen also makes a very early pitstop, coming in to drop softs and take on mediums. He was at the back anyway after his pitlane start.
2019-04-28T12:25:54Z: Leclerc lost some time overtaking on the last lap but has been quicker than Vettel for the times he's been in clear air so far. He's into the top five and will begin hunting down Verstappen now.
2019-04-28T12:25:25Z: Gasly is making good progress up the order, he's now 13th and chasing Magnussen's Haas as his next target.
2019-04-28T12:24:58Z: Leclerc is now on Perez for fifth - and the Ferrari takes it fairly easily.
2019-04-28T12:24:38Z: Kubica is under investigation for a start procedure infringement, amid reports he was in the pitlane too early before the race.
2019-04-28T12:24:33Z: Verstappen is four seconds from the back of Vettel's Ferrari, so he has a bit of work to do now to get into the podium fight proper.
2019-04-28T12:23:52Z: Kvyat has brought his Toro Rosso into the pits. He switches from softs to mediums and rejoins.
2019-04-28T12:23:45Z: Fastest lap for Bottas on lap five, although Hamilton does a personal best that is two tenths slower.
2019-04-28T12:23:23Z: This time Verstappen gets it done - complete with a slide under braking. The Red Bull is past Perez into fourth.
2019-04-28T12:23:05Z: Bottas is roughly three tenths quicker in the first sector on every lap than Hamilton, which is where the two have been separated so far.
2019-04-28T12:22:10Z: Bottas has stretched to 2.8s clear of Hamilton, while Bottas's gap to Vettel is over seven seconds now. Mercedes running away with this one in the early stages.
2019-04-28T12:22:07Z: Verstappen is still doing everything he can to pass Perez for fourth without success.
2019-04-28T12:21:52Z: Stroll passes Kvyat - and first Ricciardo then Albon follow, putting Kvyat down to 12th. Problems for the Russian's Toro Rosso?
2019-04-28T12:21:29Z: Leclerc is into seventh, past Sainz's McLaren at the first corner.
2019-04-28T12:21:04Z: Midfield: 11 Ricciardo; 12 Albon; 13 Magnussen; 14 Hulkenberg; 15 Giovinazzi; 16 Grosjean; 17 Raikkonen; 18 Gasly; 19 Russell; 20 Kubica
2019-04-28T12:20:48Z: Bottas's gap to Vettel is well over six seconds in the space of three and a half laps. Mercedes pace in qualifying looks to have been legitimised in the early running here.
2019-04-28T12:20:39Z: Race order: 1 Bottas; 2 Hamilton; 3 Vettel; 4 Perez; 5 Verstappen; 6 Norris; 7 Sainz; 8 Leclerc; 9 Kvyat; 10 Stroll
2019-04-28T12:20:00Z: Ricciardo is edged back out of the points as Stroll passes him for 10th.
2019-04-28T12:19:46Z: Sainz overtakes Kvyat for seventh, and Leclerc follows him to take eighth into Turn 2.
2019-04-28T12:19:25Z: Verstappen has shaken off Norris and is now all over Perez for fourth.
2019-04-28T12:19:06Z: Alex Albon gave the outside barrier at the first corner quite a clout on the first lap as he went down the outside of Leclerc. Doesn't look like it's damaged his Toro Rosso, which is still running in 12th.
2019-04-28T12:18:42Z: The gap between the leaders is 2.4s at the end of lap two as Hamilton drops Vettel. The latter trails Hamilton by 3.4s at the end of lap two.
2019-04-28T12:18:17Z: Replays of the start show Leclerc simply got away slowly and was swamped. But he's now past Ricciardo's Renault into ninth.
2019-04-28T12:17:46Z: Bottas was 0.3s quicker than Hamilton alone in the first sector of the second lap, helping him stretch that two-second lead.
2019-04-28T12:17:11Z: As Bottas has scampered away, Vettel has remained close to Hamilton's Mercedes.
2019-04-28T12:17:05Z: That Norris attack on Verstappen showed how powerful the tow is here - the McLaren stormed up on the Red Bull down the main straight and forced it to defend the inside at Turn 1.
2019-04-28T12:16:14Z: Hamilton attacked Bottas for most of the first half of the lap but Bottas has established a lead of over two seconds over his team-mate.
2019-04-28T12:15:38Z: Charles Leclerc initially went backwards not forwards - he's down to 10th behind Daniel Ricciardo and Carlos Sainz Jr.
2019-04-28T12:15:24Z: Perez has joined the top four jumping the Red Bull of Max Verstappen.
2019-04-28T12:15:13Z: Order out of first corners: 1 Bottas; 2 Hamilton; 3 Vettel; 4 Perez; 5 Verstappen; 6 Norris; 7 Kvyat; 8 Sainz; 9 Ricciardo; 10 Leclerc
2019-04-28T12:14:53Z: Bottas maintains the lead after heavy pressure at Turn 1 from Hamilton.
2019-04-28T12:12:43Z: The cars are out on the formation lap, we're almost underway.
2019-04-28T12:06:28Z: With the track temperature at 43.3 degrees centigrade, that's much hotter than in qualifying yesterday. Some teams who are struggling with tyre warm-up will benefit from the increased heat.
2019-04-28T12:04:37Z: Around six minutes to go until we take the green flag.
2019-04-28T12:02:08Z: As you can see from the tweet below, there's been a shake-up to the grid with a morning penalty for Kimi Raikkonen.Alfa Romeo's Raikkonen excluded from F1 qualifying in BakuAlfa Romeo Formula 1 driver Kimi Raikkonen will start the Azerbaijan Grand Prix from the pitlane after being excluded from qualifying because of a front wing problem
2019-04-28T11:59:37Z: Hello and welcome to Autosport's live coverage of the Azerbaijan Grand Prix from Baku. It's sure to be an absolute corker.
